Sri Mulyani Cs Bahas Stabilitas Sistem Keuangan RI, Apa Hasilnya?
01 Nov 2019, 07:25 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - Komite Stabilitas Sistem Keuangan (KSSK) menggelar rapat berkala membahas sistem keuangan kuartal III-2019 Kamis lalu (31/10/2019) di Bank Indonesia (BI) Jakarta. Rapat itu dihadiri Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati, Gubernur BI Perry Warjiyo, Ketua Dewan Komisioner Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK) Wimboh Santoso, dan Ketua Dewan Komisioner Lembaga Penjamin Simpanan (LPS) Halim Alamsyah.Berdasarkan keterangan resmi Jumat (1/11/2019), rapat KSSK menyimpulkan stabilitas sistem keuangan kuartal III 2019 tetap terkendali di tengah tingginya ketidakpastian perekonomian global."Ketidakpastian ini masih dipengaruhi ketegangan hubungan dagang AS-Tiongkok, meskipun pada Oktober 2019 sedikit mereda," bunyi keterangan tersebut seperti dikutip detikcom.Ketidakpastian itu menyebabkan penurunan volume perdagangan dan revisi proyeksi pertumbuhan ekonomi dunia. Kemudian diikuti dengan melemahnya harga komoditas dan tekanan inflasi.Berbagai negara merespons perkembangan ini dengan melonggarkan kebijakan moneter dan memberikan stimulus fiskal. Imbasnya, mendorong masuknya aliran modal ke negara berkembang termasuk Indonesia.Dari sisi domestik, pertumbuhan ekonomi masih tetap baik meskipun kontraksi kinerja ekspor perlu mendapat perhatian karena berdampak pada kinerja konsumsi rumah tangga dan investasi."Neraca Pembayaran Indonesia (NPI) di triwulan III 2019 diprakirakan membaik didukung oleh surplus transaksi modal dan finansial yang tetap besar serta defisit transaksi berjalan yang terkendali. Cadangan devisa masih berada jauh di atas standar kecukupan internasional. Kinerja NPI yang membaik berdampak pada nilai tukar rupiah yang menguat. Sementara itu, inflasi terkendali pada level yang rendah dan stabil di dalam target 3,5+1%," bunyi keterangan itu lebih lanjut.Stabilitas sistem keuangan masih terkendali. Hal itu didukung ketahanan perbankan yang terjaga, likuiditas yang memadai, serta pasar uang yang stabil."Hal ini tercermin dari rasio kecukupan modal (Capital Adequacy Ratio/CAR) yang tinggi dan risiko kredit bermasalah (Non Performing Loan/NPL) yang tetap rendah. Kecukupan likuiditas tetap baik, tergambar dari rasio Alat Likuid terhadap Dana Pihak Ketiga (AL/DPK) yang tinggi," tulis keterangan itu.

Sri Mulyani Cs Discuss the Stability of the Indonesian Financial System, What Are the Results?
01 Nov 2019, 07:25 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - The Financial System Stability Committee (KSSK) held a periodic meeting to discuss the financial system in the third quarter of 2019 last Thursday (10/31/2019) at Bank Indonesia (BI) Jakarta. The meeting was attended by Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati, BI Governor Perry Warjiyo, Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Financial Services Authority (OJK) Wimboh Santoso, and Chair of the Board of Commissioners of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS) Halim Alamsyah. Based on official information Friday (11/01/2019) , the KSSK meeting concluded that the stability of the financial system in the third quarter of 2019 remained under control amid the high uncertainty of the global economy. "This uncertainty is still influenced by US-China trade relations tensions, although in October 2019 it slightly eased," the statement said as quoted by AFP. The uncertainty caused a decline trade volume and revised projections of world economic growth. Then followed by weakening commodity prices and inflationary pressures. Various countries responded to this development by loosening monetary policy and providing fiscal stimulus. As a result, it encourages capital inflows to developing countries, including Indonesia. From the domestic side, economic growth remains good although the contraction in export performance needs attention because it has an impact on household consumption and investment performance. "Indonesia's Balance of Payments (NPI) in the third quarter of 2019 is forecasted The improvement was supported by a large capital and financial account surplus and a controlled current account deficit, while foreign exchange reserves remained well above international adequacy standards, an improved performance of the balance of payments affected the rupiah exchange rate, while inflation was controlled at a low level. and stable within the target of 3.5 + 1%, "the statement read further. The stability of the financial system is still under control. This is supported by maintained banking resilience, adequate liquidity, and a stable money market. "This is reflected in the high capital adequacy ratio (CAR) and the risk of non-performing loans (NPL) which remains low. "Adequacy of liquidity remains good, illustrated by the high ratio of Liquidity Tools to Third Party Funds (AL / DPK)," wrote the statement.
